definition: the first or preliminary coat of paint or size applied to a surface, use as a basis for
details:
noun
- the first or preliminary coat of paint or size applied to a surface
= synonyms: priming
- a wall or canvas prepared to be painted on
= example: a wall or canvas prepared to be painted on
- a connection between an electrical device and a large conducting body, such as the earth (which is taken to be at zero voltage)
= synonyms: earth
- a relatively homogeneous percept extending back of the figure on which attention is focused
- the part of a scene or picture that lies behind objects in the foreground
= example: the part of a scene or picture that lies behind objects in the foreground
= synonyms: background
- a position to be won or defended in battle (or as if in battle)
= example: a position to be won or defended in battle (or as if in battle)
- a rational motive for a belief or action
= synonyms: reason
- the solid part of the earth's surface
= synonyms: land
- material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
= synonyms: land
- a relation that provides the foundation for something
= synonyms: footing, basis
- the loose soft material that makes up a large part of the land surface
= synonyms: earth
verb
- use as a basis for
= synonyms: base
- instruct someone in the fundamentals of a subject
- connect to a ground
= example: connect to a ground
- fix firmly and stably
= synonyms: anchor
- cover with a primer
= synonyms: undercoat
- hit onto the ground
- hit a groundball
= example: hit a groundball
- throw to the ground in order to stop play and avoid being tackled behind the line of scrimmage
- place or put on the ground
- confine or restrict to the ground
= example: confine or restrict to the ground
- hit or reach the ground
= synonyms: run aground
- bring to the ground
= example: bring to the ground
= synonyms: strand
